intro: Franchetella platyphylla, commonly known as the flat-leafed fern, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its delicate, lance-shaped leaves that are usually arranged alternately along the stem. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It is native to regions of Southeast Asia, including parts of China and Vietnam. Franchetella platyphylla prefers moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
